adultAdhdAssessment.title: Adult ADHD Self-Assessment
adultAdhdAssessment.subtitle: A scientifically validated evaluation based on the WHO Adult ADHD Self-Report Scale (ASRS-v1.1)

disclaimer.simple: This tool helps you understand your attention patterns - not a medical diagnosis

aboutScale.title: About the ASRS Scale
aboutScale.content: The WHO Adult ADHD Self-Report Scale (ASRS-v1.1) is a widely-used, evidence-based assessment tool developed by the World Health Organization in collaboration with Harvard Medical School researchers.

features.professional: Based on WHO-validated assessment tools for adults
features.comprehensive: Evaluates both inattention and hyperactivity symptoms in adults
features.evidence: Provides objective, structured evaluation with 90% sensitivity

infoStep.title: Assessment Information
infoStep.subtitle: Please provide basic information for this assessment
infoStep.subject: Who is this assessment for?
infoStep.subjectPlaceholder: e.g., myself, my partner, family member

questions.question1: How often do you have trouble wrapping up the final details of a project, once the challenging parts have been done?
questions.question2: How often do you have difficulty getting things in order when you have to do a task that requires organization?
questions.question3: How often do you have problems remembering appointments or obligations?
questions.question4: When you have a task that requires a lot of thought, how often do you avoid or delay getting started?
questions.question5: How often do you fidget or squirm with your hands or feet when you have to sit down for a long time?
questions.question6: How often do you feel overly active and compelled to do things, like you were driven by a motor?
questions.question7: How often do you make careless mistakes when you have to work on a boring or difficult project?
questions.question8: How often do you have difficulty keeping your attention when you are doing boring or repetitive work?
questions.question9: How often do you have difficulty concentrating on what people say to you, even when they are speaking to you directly?
questions.question10: How often do you misplace or have difficulty finding things at home or at work?
questions.question11: How often are you distracted by activity or noise around you?
questions.question12: How often do you leave your seat in meetings or other situations where you are expected to remain seated?
questions.question13: How often do you feel restless or fidgety?
questions.question14: How often do you have difficulty unwinding and relaxing when you have time to yourself?
questions.question15: How often do you find yourself talking too much when you are in social situations?
questions.question16: When you're in a conversation, how often do you find yourself finishing the sentences of the people you are talking to, before they can finish them themselves?
questions.question17: How often do you have difficulty waiting your turn in situations when turn taking is required?
questions.question18: How often do you interrupt others when they are busy?

results.title: Assessment Results
results.subtitle: Based on your responses to the WHO Adult ADHD Self-Report Scale (ASRS-v1.1)
results.subject: Subject
results.recommendation: Consider consulting with a healthcare professional for further evaluation.

low.title: Low Likelihood of Adult ADHD
low.description: Your responses suggest a low likelihood of adult ADHD symptoms. This indicates good attention regulation and impulse control in most adult situations.

moderate.title: Moderate Likelihood of Adult ADHD
moderate.description: Your responses indicate some attention or hyperactivity concerns that may benefit from further evaluation or targeted strategies for adult ADHD management.

high.title: High Likelihood of Adult ADHD
high.description: Your responses suggest significant attention and/or hyperactivity symptoms that warrant professional evaluation. Many of these symptoms appear to occur frequently in your adult life.

gameDescriptions.stroop-effect-test: Improve cognitive flexibility and inhibition control
gameDescriptions.larger-number: Sharpen processing speed and attention to detail
